intro: Oldenlandia symplociformis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or small-leaved spiderling, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It often grows in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some areas. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various conditions make it both ecologically significant and challenging to manage.
